instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00134: What is 820-00134? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00134</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not powering up. LED 1 blinking
threads.message: Have this iMac 27” (haven’t done much work on these) that isn’t powering up. Led 1 is blinking, so Swapped power supply with same outcome. Led1 is solid with cpu removed, so replaced the cpu with the same outcome. Note, when the power button is pressed, led1 blinks a lot faster. Any suggestions on where to start? Yep

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00134</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not powering up. LED 1 blinking
threads.message:
Change <TRANSISTOR>Q8490</TRANSISTOR> first.
You may need to change <TRANSISTOR>Q8450</TRANSISTOR>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00134</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not powering up. LED 1 blinking
threads.message: Ordered the transistors. While I wait, checked a few readings, is it normal for <SIGNAL>PP1V0_S5_REG</SIGNAL> to measure at 22 ohms and drop down to almost zero when i place a hot soldering iron on top of <CHIP>U1100</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00134</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not powering up. LED 1 blinking
threads.message: I don't have similar board for comparison...
